text: I will try asking here since the <#CFPGEKRJ7|templates> channel doesn’t seem very active :slightly_smiling_face: Anyone can help?

Has anyone come across this issue? Is it a HubSpot Bug?

I'm attempting to convert a GLOBAL module into a LOCAL module.  However, when I add the module to any page in the CMS I get this message...

```The creator of this template prevented editing this module in the content editors.```
Anyone know what I'm doing wrong or is this a CMS bug?
did you try `hs ls --portal=<portal>`?
Maybe that’s the difference between the two tests that I did. I’ll have to check again.
Are the fields in the fields.json file `"locked": true`?
How do you view an old page replaced by content staging?
I'll check on that <@U3T21PDBK>.  Thanks for the tip.
<@U3T21PDBK> nope, all set to `"locked": false`
Not sure of another way other than the page's revision history

Hello Everyone! I have a quick question. We have embedded our custom HubSpot Knowledge base into our application and are presented when a "three dashed" toggle on the top right of the screen. When editing the Knowledge, it's not presented, but when I switch to phone view using F12 it's visible. It seems to be on HubSpot's end, as it's present before even embedding it into our application. Any way to get rid of it? I've been redirected here, so if this not a tech-heavy question my apologies. (I'll attach a image below, circled in red, of what I'm talking about)

Hello. we need help solving this issue:

We are setting up Service hub. We have workflows that send our customers emails when they submit tickets. We need those emails to be “attached” to their tickets, so that the agent can reply to those emails and the customer can have 1 conversation in their email inbox about their ticket, but that seems to not be working right now.  if the customer replies to the automated email, then it gets associated with their ticket, but we need the agent to be able to send an email before the customer replies.

is there anywhere specifically here (e.g., a channel) where i could get help w/ the service hub in general, or this question in particlar?
Generally speaking the format you should be doing commands in is `hs <command> <subcommand> --<flags>`
revision history. Depending on how long ago content staging was used, it would also appear in archived pages
The email that gets sent to the customer, can it also be sent to the agent?
Hmm I believe that’s probably a question for <#CD432DF3K|new-to-HubSpot-cms>
Send an image of your file structure?

You may wish to create an event using Google Tag Manager: 
<https://www.simoahava.com/amp/analytics/element-visibility-trigger-google-tag-manager/|https://www.simoahava.com/amp/analytics/element-visibility-trigger-google-tag-manager/>
The Element Visibility Trigger In Google Tag Manager

How <@UQWGKUEN7> ?

And, <@U01RU55DN1H> --

Create a thank you page
Create a rich text field on the thank you page
Embed the contact properties as tokens in the rich text field {{contact.firstname}} will appear with the filled in info etc al

Hmm! Thanks for this! I have Marketing Enterprise, which allows for landing pages but neither HubDB nor the CMS product (eg website hosting). So, that would mean the options are down to heavily-customized blog?
How would you achieve this with custom objects? Just curious.
Check out <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C960Q64G4/p1603487823091700|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C960Q64G4/p1603487823091700>
I would suggest embedding the form :-/

<@U01FALE1PD1> if you add the form using the embed code you can modify the script to grab all of the input values before it submits then you can use all of that to do whatever you want. 

If you’re just using the normal form modules you can likely intercept the process using the jQuery on submit method to do whatever you want as well. 

I def wouldn’t go through the hassle of trying to return fetch a submission using the api or anything like that just to display what they submitted. 

That seems like a lot of unneeded work.
Does that make sense?
Right right. I’m wondering if I just copied it over incorrectly - being in a confused state or if that’s how I actually wrote it
Possibly! Is there a script that I can copy that will get me started with scraping data that is typed into fields before it's submitted?
I can write you a starting place when I get back home
